title: Verizon outage leaves thousands of users without signal: When will network be restored? Check latest update
snippet: Verizon is facing a significant cellular and data outage affecting thousands of customers. Downdetector reported over 175,000 outage requests. The company has acknowledged the situation, apologized, and is working to restore services while offering account credits to affected users.

title: Verizon outage disrupts calling and data services for wireless customers across the US
snippet: Verizon outage disrupts calling and data services for wireless customers across the US

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 could finally match Plus and Ultra models in charging speed: Report
snippet: Expected to launch in February, the Samsung Galaxy S26 may include 45W charging, a notable enhancement from the previous model's 25W. While the battery and camera specs could remain unchanged, the device is expected to follow a dual chipset strategy for different models.

title: YouTube introduces new parental controls and limits on Shorts for teens: How it works
snippet: YouTube has introduced new tools for families, including limits on Shorts viewing, clearer guidance on quality teen content, and a simplified account setup, aiming to give parents more control over how children and teenagers use the platform. Here's everything you need to know on the policy changes.

title: EA pushes Battlefield 6 Season 2 launch to February: Here's why
snippet: Electronic Arts has delayed Battlefield 6 Season 2 to February 17, extending Season 1 with new updates, weekly challenges, and bonus rewards. EA says the decision follows community feedback and aims to deliver more polished content for players.

title: Elon Musk pushes back against Grok AI image abuse claims, ‘It will refuse to produce anything illegal’
snippet: Elon Musk has dismissed allegations that Grok produces illegal images of minors, saying the AI only responds to user prompts and refuses unlawful requests, while acknowledging that rare misuse attempts are treated as bugs and fixed promptly.

title: Amazon Republic Day Sale pre deals reveal discounts on laptops under  ₹40,000 from brands like HP, Dell, Asus and more
snippet: Amazon Republic Day Sale pre-deals reveal discounts on laptops under  ₹40,000 from HP, Dell, Asus, and more, offering early savings on budget-friendly models.

title: Google opens access to AI models for medical imaging and speech, unveils MedGemma 1.5 and MedASR: All you need to know
snippet: Google has launched MedGemma 1.5 and MedASR, two open AI models for healthcare research. The tools focus on analysing medical images and transcribing clinical speech, offering researchers and developers flexible, community-driven medical AI solutions.

title: Free Starlink access for Iran seen as game changer for demonstrators getting their message out

title: Google adds vertical video support to Veo 3.1 for shorts and reels: How it works
snippet: Google has upgraded its Veo 3.1 AI model on Tuesday with better video generation, improved prompt understanding, stronger character consistency, and native vertical video support for Shorts, Reels, and TikTok, along with enhanced 1080p quality and 4K upscaling.

title: California to investigate xAI over Grok chatbot images, officials say
